title: Misstee
description:
Dog and pony show pixel pushing. Drink the Kool-aid going forward,for flesh that out or thought shower we need a recap by eod, cob or whatever comes first yet i dont care if you got some copy, why you dont use officeipsumcom or something like that ?. Not enough bandwidth powerpoint.

Annoying bug

Bunny, yet let's prioritize the low-hanging fruit the last person we talked to said this would be ready. Cross functional teams enable out of the box brainstorming that ipo will be a game-changer what about scaling components to a global audience? but put it on the parking lot nor commitment to the cause for i don't want to drain the whole swamp, i just want to shoot some alligators

title: Calculator
description:
• DOM manipulation (create an element, set attribute, add class)
  • JavaScript (arrays, events, scope, functions)
  • Separate business logic from UI (event handlers, update dom) code

title: Cash Register
description:
• DOM manipulation (create an element, set attribute, add class)
  • JavaScript (arrays, events, scope, functions)
  • Separate business logic from UI (event handlers, update dom) code

title: Utopian News
description: Created this Utopian News to practice the CSS grid model. I also learnt a bit more about Javascript specifically about date formatting. I know this can be done with libraries such as moment but I wanted to try by myself.

title: Etch-a-Sketch
description: On my third project for Odin Project. where I was asked to “build a browser version of something between a sketchpad and an Etch-A-Sketch” to flex my DOM manipulation skills. I also learn CSS grid. I had a lot of fun with this one and hope you enjoy it.

title: Concrete Surfers
description: A simple landing page that with HTML, CSS and javascript.

title: Rock Paper Scissors
description: This another assignment for the Odin Project. Although I was asked to create a game that would be played on the console. I decided that this was a chance for me to integrate everything I had learned to that point. I build this game using CSS and JavaScript. I am really proud of myself and have to thank the help of Andre and the coaches from CodeBar Barcelona.

title: Photo Gallery
description: To continue my journey through HTML and CSS I created an info page (content from wikipedia) about one of my favourite animals. At the same time, I started learning JavaScript following the curriculum in the Odin Project, so I included a go to top button with JS. I looked at examples and adapted to my page.

title: African Elephant
description: To continue my journey through HTML and CSS I created an info page (content from wikipedia) about one of my favourite animals. At the same time, I started learning JavaScript following the curriculum in the Odin Project, so I included a go to top button with JS. I looked at examples and adapted to my page.

title: First Layout
description: When I decided to learn web-development, I found the Odin Project and decided to do the Web development 101. The first assignment was to clone the Google Homepage, it was a very simple exercise but I remember how much I enjoy seeing my work on the web-browser. I did project to practice what I had learnt on my first assignment: git/GitHub - create a repository, clone, add, commit and push; HTML - structure and semantics, elements, tags, attributes; CSS - elements, selectors, declarations, properties and values;
